intro: Lastila hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy lastila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
